titles.title: Lord Let My Heart Still Turn To Thee (familiar

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Lord Let my heart still turn to Thee In all my hours of waking thought Not let this heart e'er wish to flee Or think or feel where Thou art not{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}In every hour of pain and woe When nought on earth this heart can cheer When sighs will burst this heart can cheer Lord hush the sigh and chase the tear{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}In every dream of earthly bliss Do Thou dear Jesus present be Nor let a thought of happiness On earth intrude apart from Thee{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}To my last lingering thought at night Do Thou Lord Jesus still be near And ere the dawn of opening light In still small accents wake mine ear{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Whene'er I read Thy sacred word Bright on the page in glory shine And let me say "This precious Lord In all His full salvation's mine"{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}And when before the throne I kneel Hear from that throne of grace my prayer And let each hope of heaven I feel Burn with the thought to meet Thee there{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Thus teach me Lord to look to Thee In every hour of waking thought Nor let me ever wish to be Or think or feel where Thou art not{/lang-eng}
